content.title: Banishree Scholarship
content.details: The main objective of the scholarship is to assist and encourage students with special needs to study as well as acquire technical/professional/vocational training to enable them to earn a living and become useful members of society.
benefits: Middle and High School (Standard VI to VIII and IX to XI): Rs. 250/-
Readerâ€™s Allowance for visually challenged candidates
Additional monthly allowance for orthopaedically handicapped students
eligibility: The applicant must be a bona fide resident of Orissa.
The applicant should be a regular student of an educational institution.
The parental/family income of the applicant is not more than Rs.60,000 per annum.
The applicant is not receiving any financial assistance/stipend/scholarship from State Govt./Central Govt. under any other scheme.
The student will continue to get the scholarship if he enrols and regularly attends any recognised institution irrespective of whether he has passed or not in a particular year.
content.application_process: Choose the option 'New Application'. Provide the required details in Student Details, Institute Details, Other Details, Bank Account Details. Submit.
documents_required: Disability Certificate issued by Medical Board
Income Certificate issued by Revenue Officer, not below the rank of Tahasildar or any other officer of equivalent status.
Mark sheets of the last examination passed duly attested by a Gazetted Officer or the Head of the Institution concerned.

faqs.question: What are the benefits under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Primary (Standard I to V): Rs.200/-, Middle and High School (Standard VI to VIII and IX to XI): Rs. 250/-, College (+2 & +3): Rs. 300/-, College (P.G.): Rs. 350/-, Technical and vocational training: Rs. 350/-.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility criteria?
faqs.answer: The applicant must be a bona fide resident of Orissa, should be a regular student of an educational institution, with a family income not more than Rs.60,000 per annum, and not receiving any financial assistance from other schemes.

faqs.question: What is the application process?
faqs.answer: Follow the official website, choose 'New Application', provide required details, and submit.

faqs.question: What documents are required?
faqs.answer: Disability Certificate, Income Certificate, and Mark sheets of the last examination passed.
